boat.name: Barbara Agnes
boat.full_description: Barbara Agnes is a Heard 28. She was purchased in 2002 and kept on the Solent. She was previously based on the East Coast at Burnham on Crouch.
boat.short_description: Barbara Agnes is a Heard 28, built in Mylor, 1992.

for_sales.sales_text:
Percy Dalton designed, Heard built, gaff pilot cutter/Falmouth working boat. Built in Mylor 1992. LOA 28’ 6", LWL 26’ 5", Beam 10’, Depth 5’ 1", Draft 5’

GRP hull, sheathed ply deck, transom hung rudder, long keel, epoxy treated, tiller steering. Beta DD100S 28HP diesel engine commissioned 2002 and professionally serviced annually. Stainless steel standing rigging and spruce 36’ mast (both replaced 2012), Columbian pine bowsprit. Gaff main, jib, staysail, common tow foresail, topsail, two storm jibs. Four Barient winches, Faversham coal stove, Flavel Vanessa gas cooker ( 2 rings plus oven & grill ) ITT Jabasco toilet.

Sleeps four in two cabins - very well thought out storage etc.,  good condition below decks. Two anchors plus electronic and general equipment including legs for beaching. Full service history available. Two covers (cockpit and winter).

May be viewed at Bucklers Hard, Beaulieu River, Hampshire.
